second_reading.title: Letter to the Ephesians
second_reading.text:
[[Ep 5,15]]Brothers and sisters: Watch carefully then how you live, not as foolish persons but as wise,
[[Ep 5,16]]making the most of the opportunity, because the days are evil.
[[Ep 5,17]]Therefore, do not continue in ignorance, but try to understand what is the will of the Lord.
[[Ep 5,18]]And do not get drunk on wine, in which lies debauchery, but be filled with the Spirit,
[[Ep 5,19]]addressing one another (in) psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and playing to the Lord in your hearts,
[[Ep 5,20]]giving thanks always and for everything in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ to God the Father.

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 34,2]]I will bless the LORD at all times; 
his praise shall be ever in my mouth.
[[Ps 34,3]]Let my soul glory in the LORD; 
the lowly will hear me and be glad.

[[Ps 34,4]]Glorify the LORD with me, 
let us together extol his name.
[[Ps 34,5]]I sought the LORD, and he answered me 
and delivered me from all my fears.

[[Ps 34,6]]Look to him that you may be radiant with joy, 
and your faces may not blush with shame.
[[Ps 34,7]]When the poor one called out, the LORD heard, 
and from all his distress he saved him.

first_reading.title: Book of Proverbs
first_reading.text:
[[Pr 9,1]]Wisdom has built her house, she has set up her seven columns;
[[Pr 9,2]]She has dressed her meat, mixed her wine, yes, she has spread her table.
[[Pr 9,3]]She has sent out her maidens; she calls from the heights out over the city:
[[Pr 9,4]]"Let whoever is simple turn in here; to him who lacks understanding, I say,
[[Pr 9,5]]Come, eat of my food, and drink of the wine I have mixed!
[[Pr 9,6]]Forsake foolishness that you may live; advance in the way of understanding."

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
gospel.text:
[[Jn 6,51]]Jesus said to the crowds:
"I am the living bread that came down from heaven; whoever eats this bread will live forever; and the bread that I will give is my flesh for the life of the world."
[[Jn 6,52]]The Jews quarreled among themselves, saying, "How can this man give us (his) flesh to eat?"
[[Jn 6,53]]Jesus said to them, "Amen, amen, I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you do not have life within you.
[[Jn 6,54]]Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him on the last day.
[[Jn 6,55]]For my flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.
[[Jn 6,56]]Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood remains in me and I in him.
[[Jn 6,57]]Just as the living Father sent me and I have life because of the Father, so also the one who feeds on me will have life because of me.
[[Jn 6,58]]This is the bread that came down from heaven. Unlike your ancestors who ate and still died, whoever eats this bread will live forever."
